Try it with different types of cheeses and see what works best for you. I have tried smoked Gouda, parmesan, mozzarella and many more."   icons / ellipsis / ellipsis-horizontal save Download Print Share I Made This photo by *Parsley* Ready In: 14mins Ingredients: 5 Serves: 4 Nutrition information Advertisement ingredients Units: US 3 cups cabbage, shredded 1⁄2 cup water 1 teaspoon salt 1⁄4 cup light cream or 1/4 cup table cream 1⁄2 cup mexican oaxaca cheese, grated Advertisement directions Cook cabbage in boiling salted water until tender.Drain and return to pot.Add cream and cheese over low heat, stirring constantly until cheese melts and coats cabbage. icons / social / pinterest icons / email Questions & Replies Sign In to Ask a Question Got a question? Share it with the community! Advertisement Reviews MOST POPULARMOST RECENT Write A Review A nice, quick and simple cabbage side dish. I used sharp cheddar for the cheese. Just added some pepper and I think maybe a little cayenne pepper or sweet paprika would be nice on this, too. Thanx for a great cabbage quickie!   icons / ellipsis / ellipsis-horizontal *Parsley* Reply 1 Very nice! I used queso fresca for the cheese. I enjoyed this! Made for Pick a Chef 2007.   icons / ellipsis / ellipsis-horizontal Sharon123 Reply Advertisement RECIPE SUBMITTED BY Bippie icons / following Follow Me 11 Followers 44 Recipes 24 Tweaks I come from a very Polish family with 5 brothers and a sister. I love to cook just about anything Polish and I'm pretty good at cleaning out the refridgerator and making something worth eating. Just got married on 07/07/07, so I would love to get some Just for 2 dinner menus. Finally enjoying the wonderful California weather. I haven't started baking, but I'm really excited to get back into the contests here.
